PHASE SUMMARY — Jacques Paganel — late

Role: 
- Maintains a calm demeanor despite initial agitation
- Acts as a messenger, tasked with delivering a letter to Tom Austin

Traits:
- Initially exhibits nervous excitation and agitation
- Gradually regains composure and appears decided to keep a secret
- Has strong reasons for keeping a secret (implied, but not explicitly stated)
- Appears to be a loyal and devoted member of the group (evidenced by his willingness to deliver the letter)

Relationships:
- Close relationship with Glenarvan, as evidenced by Glenarvan's trust in Paganel and his tasking of Paganel with delivering the letter
- Interacts with other members of the group, including Captain Mangles and MacNabb, but no significant relationships are explicitly described

Notable behaviors:
- Initially struggles with controlling his emotions and words
- Eventually regains his composure and appears calm
- Disappears by a path along the edge of the wood after delivering the letter
